word:
Chapter 36 - Pie, Cake, Pastry and Puddings

                                            H. to L., Chap. 1, p. 53 
     The human family have indulged an increasing desire for rich food, until it has become a fashion to crowd all the delicacies possible into the stomach. Especially at parties of pleasure is the appetite indulged with but little restrain. Rich dinners and late suppers are partaken of, consisting of highly seasoned meats with rich gravies, rich cakes, pies, ice cream, etc.
